nodes.text: Fight back, by all means - when necessary. But if you can legally buy a gun for that purpose, it means that your attacker is that much more likely to be armed as well. That's a scenario you don't want to encounter - especially if you don't happen to be carrying your weapon at the time.
The attacker is usually armed in spite of gun control laws. All they do is disarm the law abiding. Not to mention the lack of enforcement on criminals.

Coincidentally, see my most recent post in the 'Philippines' thread.  If you look at the proportion of (for example) murders in the UK, you will find that a piffling 7% of homicides were carried out by shooting in 07/08 (and 8% in 06/07). To say that 'most attackers are armed' is missing the mark by a factor of 7. Incidentally, over 50% of homicides were committed by gun in the US. And you can't blame it on the gans, either (although they certainly contributed). EDIT: NATO posted. I feel that this is a suitable reply to his post, too - although I'd add that the media in any country does tend to blow statistics out of proportion. Or take a single incident and imply that it is a nationwide epidemic.
Armed does include knives, axes, clubs etc!
